author: Solen Le Net
title: European city hours away from UK where temperatures reach 15C in January | Europe | Travel | Express.co.uk
text:
The town of Seville is brimming with historical landmarks to explore (Image: Getty) A destination in Spain has been touted as one of the top European destinations to visit off-season, as visitors can enjoy longer and hotter days.
Sited in the heart of Andalucia, Seville has long enchanted travelers with its sunny dispositions, but temperatures can reach uncomfortable highs during the summer.
The destination was recently acknowledged in the travel blog Thoughtful Travel, which states: “Even in the off-season, Seville is extremely lively and all the main attractions are open [...]
“And despite it being wintertime, the trees that line the streets are brimming with baby oranges, perfuming the air with a light and pleasant citrus scent.”
“Seville, if you don’t already know it, is nicknamed ‘the frying pan’ of Europe for its torrid and hot summers."

Having visited the town in January, the traveler noted that the nights can be a bit chilly, with temperatures averaging around 15 degrees celsius during the day.
The specialist team from Omio identifies Seville as a budget-friendly travel destination too, with return flights from London available for just £37.
Known as the cradle of tapas, Seville offers travelers an abundance of dining options in January, with the added perk of shorter wait times.
To add to its allure, the Andalusian town has been hailed as Europe’s most pedestrian-friendly city by experts at Preply.
The air in Seville still carries the soft scent of citrus trees throughout winter (Image: Getty) Visitors can take delight in strolling through the city and meandering effortlessly from landmarks like Plaza de España.
The Parque de Maria Luisa offers tourist respite from the noise of the city, with duck ponds, landscaped gardens, and towering trees.
A Tripadvisor spokesperson said: “Originally founded as a Roman city and now home to three UNESCO World Heritage Sites, Seville is bursting with antique charm.
“The Alcazar palace complex is a stunning collage of architectural styles, and the Cathedral will impress you with its beauty and its status as the burial site of Christopher Columbus.
“The Metropol Parasol is the World's largest wooden structure, a massive mix of girls and swirls that contains a market and a terrace observatory."
